title: Abetalipoproteinemia: Epidemiology and Demographics
short_description: Clinical document describing the prevalence, incidence, and demographic characteristics of abetalipoproteinemia, a rare genetic disorder.
long_description: This clinical research document provides epidemiological information about abetalipoproteinemia, a rare inherited disorder. The document details that the condition affects fewer than 1 in 1,000,000 people globally, with no gender or racial preferences. It highlights that the disorder is more common in populations with high rates of consanguineous marriages and typically presents symptoms during infancy. The document serves as a reference for understanding the demographic distribution and prevalence patterns of this rare genetic condition.
